name: Jamie Tanna
text:
Mentioned by https://www.jvt.me/week-notes/2024/45/

> if you're interested to chat ahead of thenAs Roy Tang wrote about the incredibly disappointing results in the US Election:The USA

summary.value: What happened in the week of 2024-11-04?

content.html:
A busy week at work with post-incident follow-ups and an incredible downer in the US Elections.

  • Got a haircut ahead of the few big meetings this week
  • And somehow ended up stepping on one of my hairs, which was painful, hard to find and definitely a "huh, how could that even happen" but ????????
  • The build-up for the week led to Wednesday, where I was presenting about last week's incident, which led to a spike in my heartrate
    • Went well though, and all the prep paid off, as well as being a very good opportunity for being a very highly visible opportunity to show my great communication
  • Finally got around to watching Sebastian's talk and it was a great talk as well as having a couple of shout outs ????????
  • Feeling run-down, especially on/after Wednesday, and feeling the stress of the incident onwards, and some general burnout
  • Been very happy with Morph being in the living room, and the two little ones coexisting ???? he's also been coming in when we're not around (but leave it open for him) and he's been much more resilient to Cookie's sometimes
  • Hit my 14th anniversary on LinkedIn ????
  • Booked a spa day for Friday ???????? It's my Shut It Down Day and so we're taking a well deserved spa day off
  • Ahead of Joe, my new manager, starting tomorrow, I've been updating my Manual of Me
  • Had a very good Rakki Rakkas
  • Also had a very good Chick n Shakes today
  • The OpenUK Digital Meetup was very good - both Ana and Calum were great speakers, we had a good amount of attendees, and good post-event discussion on Slack
  • Alexa's had an update that's broken the "what's the time" functionality, which is wild
  • Carol came round to pick up the desk, and had a nice catch up with her and Dougie
  • Dropping Anna off in West Bridgford was weird without Waze, as neither of our phones would connect
  • Tried GitHub Copilot for the first time
    • As I'd seen someone noting that Open Source maintainers can get it free (and I'm one of the eligible ones)
    • it helped a little on my skippedReason blog, but didn't use it too much
  • Firefox Nightly Android app has restored the long-press functionality, thankfully
  • In Apex Legends, playing Launch Royale has been a somewhat fun reminder of how broken a number of things used to be, and am enjoying the "gifts from the rift"
  • Got info about my annual stock grant, and very happy - it's not yet on my /salary/ page, but it will be when I've had it confirmed I'm getting it (mid December, as far as I remember). Drop me a DM on Slack if you're interested to chat ahead of then
  • As Roy Tang wrote about the incredibly disappointing results in the US Election:

The USA has once again failed an IQ test. Donald Trump will be their next president. The world braces for things to come.

In dependency-management-data:

  • More progress towards renovate-packagedata-diff, renamed from renovate-packagedump-diff, but still not quite happy to get it merged
  • Wrote a post on skippedReason, after spending some time trying to get it working with jq / Ruby
  • Toying with not deduplicating rows in renovate
  • Upgraded renovate-graph to support Renovate v39 - which came out last week

Watched:

  • Two Broke Girls
  • Saturday Night Live (on YouTube)
